Job Description

Ref ID: 01009620

Classification: Accountant - Staff

Compensation: DOE

If you're interested in becoming a critical part of an innovative company, Robert Half Finance has an opportunity for a full-time Staff Accountant. To excel in this position, you should enjoy challenges and be adept at managing multiple projects. If you can prepare journal entries, monthly and year-end closings, bank reconciliation, fixed asset maintenance, and general ledger reconciliation, you might be right for this Staff Accountant position. This role will involve internal reporting during the monthly close, participation in compliance, interaction with our external auditors for quarterly reviews and annual audits, and reviewing schedules reporting processes. This company, based in the Buffalo Grove, Illinois area, offers a challenging and multi-faceted opportunity where effort is rewarded. If you are a detail-oriented and analytical thinker with a talent for creating Financial Statements, Cash Flow projections, and Budgets, you will thrive in this role. For immediate consideration, please email your resume to [Click Here to Email Your Resum?] Responsibilities - Manage reconciliation, depreciation, and fixed asset ledgers - Partake in various department-wide initiatives - Upon request, take part in special projects and impromptu reporting - Maintain intercompany transactions, billings, and reconciliation - Prepare monthly financial close workbooks to support the month end, quarter end and year end closing process - In-depth knowledge of reconciling month end balance sheet accounts - Prepare analyses for monthly balance sheets and income statements for management to report on - Regularly maintain and reconcile journal entries - Organize and review a variety of financial data, reporting it in a way that is useful and understandable - Arrange schedules for capital lease and monthly payments - Conduct month end close and compose journal entries with minimal supervision - Maintain, implement, and adhere to internal controls while ensuring that accounting procedures comply with GAAP - Produce complex journal entries and account reconciliations which include, but are not limited to, cash, prepaid expenses, and payroll
- Competent with spreadsheets and databases - Mature organizational, written and verbal communication skills - BA/BS or equivalent in Accounting, Finance or Economics - Solid understanding of month end closings - Ability to work in a dynamic and changing environment - Exemplary analytical, quantitative and social skills - Commitment and abilities to meet critical business deadlines - Self-starter with efficient time management and organizational skills - Proficient in ERP systems - Spreadsheet and database capabilities - Attention to detail and proven ability to follow standard procedures is a requirement - Recent and relevant accounting experience For immediate consideration, please email your resume to [Click Here to Email Your Resum?]

Job Description

Ref ID: 00954410

Classification: Accountant - Staff

Compensation: $55,000.00 to $65,000.00 per year

Robert Half Finance has a full-time opportunity for Staff Accountant candidates who want to become a critical part of an innovative company. This could be the ideal position for you, if you are driven by a challenging work environment with many components. You might be a good fit for this Staff Accountant position if you can prepare journal entries, monthly and year-end closings, bank reconciliation, fixed asset maintenance, and general ledger reconciliation. This role will involve internal reporting during the monthly close, participation in compliance, interaction with our external auditors for quarterly reviews and annual audits, and reviewing schedules reporting processes. This Talladega, Alabama area-based position is a challenging, multi-faceted opportunity to work for a company that recognizes and rewards hard work. This is a position you will thrive in, if you are a detail-oriented and analytical thinker with a talent for creating Financial Statements, Cash Flow projections, and Budgets. Major responsibilities - Assemble journal entries and thorough account reconciliations that include, but are not limited to, cash, prepaid expenses, and payroll - Produce analyses for monthly balance sheets and income statements for reporting by management - Maintain depreciation, fixed asset ledgers, and reconciliation - Regular maintenance and reconciliation of journal entries - Play a part in a variety of department-wide initiatives - Manage schedules for capital lease and monthly payments - Manage intercompany reconciliation, billings, and transactions - Impromptu reporting and special projects, when requested - Perform the month end close and produce journal entries under minimal supervision - Implement, maintain, and adhere to internal controls and accounting procedures ensuring compliance with GAAP - Support the month end, quarter end and year end closing process by preparing monthly financial close workbooks - Organize and review a variety of financial data, reporting it in a way that is useful and understandable - Thorough experience with month end balance sheet account reconciliations
- Proficient in ERP systems - Outstanding analytical, quantitative and social skills - Ability to work well in matrix organization and dealing with ambiguity - Knowledge of month end closings - Comprehensive knowledge of general ledger - Takes action on items beyond formal job responsibilities - Spreadsheet and database capabilities - Dedication and requisite skills to meet critical business deadlines - Outstanding organizational, written and verbal communication skills required - Recent and relevant accounting experience - Proficient with spreadsheets and databases - BA/BS or equivalent in Accounting, Finance or Economics - Attention to detail and demonstrated ability to follow standard procedures is a requirement

If you're looking for full-time work, this terrific company is seeking a Staff Accountant. Looking for strong compensation and excellent benefits? This position could advance your career! If you're looking for work as a Staff Accountant, you'll be interested in Robert Half Finance's opportunity for ambitious and detail-oriented candidates to join a thriving, fast-paced company that recognizes talent and effort. Based in the Addison, Texas area, this role is a career-building, multi-faceted opportunity to work for a company that recognizes and rewards hard work. This position is ideal for someone with a complex understanding of Financial Statements, Cash Flow projections, and Budgets. For more information contact [Click Here to Email Your Resum?] or . What you get to do every single day - Ad hoc reporting and performing special projects upon request - Arrange schedules for capital lease and monthly payments - Maintain depreciation, fixed asset ledgers, and reconciliation - Become well-versed in month end balance sheet account reconciliations - Manage intercompany reconciliation, billings, and transactions - Maintain, implement, and adhere to internal controls while ensuring that accounting procedures comply with GAAP - Support the month end, quarter end and year end closing process by preparing monthly financial close workbooks - Compose thorough journal entries and account reconciliations which include, but are not limited to, cash, prepaid expenses, and payroll - Conduct month end close and compose journal entries with minimal supervision - Organize and review a variety of financial data, reporting it in a way that is useful and understandable - Recurring journal entries maintenance and reconciliation - Partake in various department-wide initiatives - Assemble analyses for monthly balance sheets and income statements for management reporting
- Outstanding organizational, written and verbal communication skills required - BA/BS or equivalent in Accounting, Finance or Economics - Ability to work within spreadsheets and databases - Distinguished analytical, quantitative and social skills - Ability to meet deadlines - Self-starter, ability to identify issues and resolve problems - Microsoft Excel experience - Recent and relevant accounting experience - Proficient in ERP systems - Be detailed, flexible, and organized - Comfortable working in a changing and dynamic environment - Competent with spreadsheets and databases

AC2019

Job Description

Ref ID: 04983581

Classification: Accountant - Staff

Compensation: $70,000.00 to $90,000.00 per year

Our Utah office is looking for a Staff Accountant with the desire and ability to account for multiple lines of business including corporate accounting. The office is fast-paced and utilizes various operations-level software to manage and account for a diverse portfolio of assets. The Staff Accountant is responsible for performing the established daily, monthly and quarterly accounting procedures for an assigned portfolio of properties and other business unit accounting. Responsibilities include budget-to-actual income statement review, balance sheet analysis, calculating and posting expense accruals, CAM reconciliations and lease review. The Staff Accountant will communicate extensively with the internal accounting and legal departments, the property management team and business unit managers. ? Manage and perform the Accounts Payable process ? review invoice coding and approvals and ensure proper audit trail is in place. ? Maintain sales information ? monitor collection of sales and review reports. ? Review leases and leasing activity to ensure accurate billing. ? Assist with the preparation and distribution monthly financial reports ? Assist with the management of the Accounts Receivable process ? monitor cash receipts, review and bill tenant recurring charges and billing adjustments and perform tenant ledger reconciliations. ? Oversee capital project financial processes including cash flows, reporting and tracking ? Assist with annual budget preparation ? compile key assumptions and capital budget information, maintain lease level budgeting for all tenants, review and enter budget information into the accounting system, process estimates for miscellaneous income and specialty leasing. ? Assist in Annual year-end reconciliation process ? CAM, percentage rent, insurance, utilities, sewer/trash, real estate taxes. ? Perform bank reconciliations for all entities bank accounts ? Perform budget-to-actual analyses ? Understand and monitor all aspects of the business unit balance sheets, including fixed assets, debt, receivables, payables and other balance sheet accounts ? Manage monthly accounts receivable activity, updating and reporting rent collections to team, and working with lease administrator move-ins/outs ? Calculates any late payments/interest on delinquencies ? Review and understand tenant lease agreements/amendments and other operating agreements for each business unit ? Book journal entries and perform GL account reconciliations ? Prepare monthly financial statements, fluctuation analysis with explanations and other ad hoc reporting as required ? Communicate with management regarding all aspects of property accounting areas, including property budget preparation, tenant payments, lease review and CAM analysis ? Calculate and post monthly and quarterly business unit expense accruals
Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or Finance required 2 to 3 years of accounting experience in the real estate industry desirable MRI or Yardi experience strongly preferred Microsoft Dynamics Great Plains experience strongly preferred Must possess 3 to 5 years of corporate accounting experience Strong analytical ability; understands details as well as big picture; presents meaningful analysis Strong customer focus able to mentor/assist team while providing accurate deliverables on a timely basis Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel, Outlook and Word Must be self-directed, motivated and logical in problem solving; well organized with attention to detail; follow through with assignments; well organized; self-starter and able to juggle multiple priorities Able to communicate effectively with managers and co-workers If interested please email an updated resume to [Click Here to Email Your Resum?] or call

Job Description

Ref ID: 04017262

Classification: Accounting Clerk

Compensation: $55,000.00 to $75,000.00 per year

Staff Accountants and Account Clerks looking to grow their careers with a thriving company might find the perfect job with Robert Half Finance and Accounting. This reputable, woman owned government contracting business is presently seeking a Staff Accountant who can handle both full cycle payroll (~100 employees) and full cycle accounts payable. The ideal Staff Accountant must be comfortable with matching invoices to purchase orders and/or vouchers, data entry, and assisting in the process of Accounts Payable (A/P). Additionally, the type of Staff Accountant we seek is fully capable of handling all payroll processing through ADP Workforce Now. Our clients need a Staff Accountant or Account clerk with hands on experience entering journal entries and assisting with the general ledger. The Staff Accountant position is a full-time opportunity and is situated in the Dulles corridor of Virginia. Our clients offer terrific benefits, tremendous growth opportunities, and a dynamic team culture are just a few of the great offerings this company has for you. Daily tasks outlined: - Full cycle payroll processing including: employee data entry and management, time audits, benefits, taxes, all using ADP Workforce Now - File vendor invoices and disbursements and match file A/P invoices to support accounts payable within Deltek Costpoint 7 - Classify documents with the proper expenditure codes and accounting codes - Reconcile discrepancies by examining possible sources of disagreement, recreating likely actions, and identifying the effect on other accounts; prepare correction documents as needed - Assist with general accounting tasks, including G/L account reconciliation and month-end closing, and other ad hoc projects - Utilize Deltek Costpoint 7 to create statements and reports - Carry out other related duties and work on special projects as assigned - Add financial information to journals and ledgers If you are interested in this position, please submit a resume in word format to Leila Hermes at Robert Half at [Click Here to Email Your Resum?] or call Leila Hermes at Robert Half at or contact your recruiting manager if you are already working with Robert Half.
- AA or BS/BA in Accounting or related field preferred - 2 ? 10 years of accounting experience required - Ability to multitask, collaborate and communicate well with individuals of all backgrounds in a fast-paced environment - Must have ADP WorkForce Now - Payroll for under 100 employees experience required - Hands-on experience with Full Cycle Payroll - Solid understanding of garnishments payroll - Prior experience with payroll - Experience with bi-Monthly Payroll - Solid understanding of in-house payroll - Strong familiarity with payroll taxes - Skills in Accounts Payable (AP) - Practical knowledge of Deltek - Wide ranging experience with ADP Workforce Now - Costpoint 7 (Deltek) experience desired - General familiarity with Deltek Costpoint - Experience with Microsoft Excel - Familiar with Spreadsheet and ERP system If you are interested in this position, please submit a resume in word format to Leila Hermes at Robert Half at [Click Here to Email Your Resum?] or call Leila Hermes at Robert Half at or contact your recruiting manager if you are already working with Robert Half.

Job Description

ELECTRONIC PAYMENT EXCHANGE - ACCOUNTANT

Troy, MI

We are looking for an Accountant to join our Finance team in our Troy headquarters. You will be performing accurate and expedient accounting functions in this role; we are looking for someone with solid mathematical skills who can identify errors.

What you will be doing:
  • General ledger and bank account reconciliations
  • Month-end close including journal entry preparation, balance sheet and income statement account analysis for multiple entities
  • Cash reporting and forecasting
  • General accounting administration functions
  • Assist the department with ad hoc projects as needed
What we need from you:
  • Bachelor's Degree with a concentration in Accounting
  • At least 2 years of progressive accounting experience
  • Advanced capability with Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Word
  • Experience with Microsoft Dynamics Great Plains & Microsoft Access a plus
  • Must be able to work independently, and have a positive attitude with a willingness to be flexible
  • Must be well organized and detail oriented
  • Credit Card Processing experience a plus
Why should you come to work with us:
  • We focus on learning and development
  • Brand new state of the art cafeteria on-site
  • Modern and energizing building
  • We work hard, and also have fun events
  • Company wellness program
  • Always something new happening to keep things upbeat
GET TO KNOW NORTH AMERICAN BANCARD

Electronic Payment Exchange (EPX), a wholly owned subsidiary of North American Bancard, is the unified, stable and secure processing platform with end-to-end payment solutions for merchants, banks, ISOs, and franchises around the world.

North American Bancard helps businesses prosper through smarter commerce for all and we're committed to building the next generation of payment technologies and experiences. More than 250,000 satisfied merchants trust us to process more than $34 billion worth of transactions every single year. Propelled by cutting-edge technology, user-friendly products and features, and the best customer service in the business, we continue to innovate to satisfy our clients and their customers.

At North American Bancard, we celebrate diversity and create an inclusive environment for everyone. We are an equal opportunity employer.
